intro: Eriocaulon cubense, commonly known as the Cuban threadgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale green flowers. It is typically found in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, tropical environments. Eriocaulon cubense plays a role in maintaining ecological balance in its native regions by supporting local biodiversity.
